ygData.subject: RE: Question about Impart Strength
ygData.msgSnippet: i always used to cast the spells and replace w something else.  its a pain, but than again its not like you have something else to do while meditating.
ygData.messageBody:
i always used to cast the spells and replace w something else. its a pain,
but than again its not like you have something else to do while meditating.

belphenor



>
>I buffed my pet a few times this way, and did notice that he hit for more
>damage. The problem that I have with the spells are that they take
>strength
>away from you. My outtings last a very long time before I go back to town
>and sell, so weight was a huge factor only having a str of 65, so when you
>take away 10, I would become encumbered and lose some agi as well, so I
>quit
>using the spell. You are probably meleeing at this level too, so if you
>did
>want to use this spell, use siphon strength with it so that you are back up
>to your potential, but that takes 2 spells slots away from a lot of other
>more useful spells.
>
>Vanelin Blackheart
>35th lvl DE Nec - Povar
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Nat Russo [mailto:nrusso@...]
>Sent: Friday, February 11, 2000 10:24 AM
>To: EQ_Necromancers
>Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Question about Impart Strength
>
>
>From: "Nat Russo" <nrusso@...>
>
>Hi Folks,
>
>I have a lvl 13 Necromancer on Solusek Ro (Mujahid). My question deals
>with
>buffing your pet. Has anyone here had any experience with "Impart
>Strength"? Is it worth casting it on your pet to give him an extra 10
>strength?
>
>Thanks in advance,
>Mujahid
>
